subject: Travel
title: Samarkand: The Jewel of the Road
description: A short lesson to help you apply Samarkand: The Jewel of the Road.

hook.text: Samarkand was already ancient when Alexander the Great conquered it in 329 BC.

buildup.text: Sitting at the crossroads of trade routes, it became the richest city in Central Asia.

discovery.text: Tamerlane made it his capital in the 1300s and filled it with mosques covered in turquoise tile.

twist.text: Genghis Khan had destroyed it completely a century earlier. Tamerlane rebuilt it from nothing.

climax.text: Today its Registan Square is considered one of the most beautiful plazas on Earth.

punchline.text: Destroyed and reborn, Samarkand refused to die.

quiz.question: Who rebuilt Samarkand after Genghis Khan destroyed it?
